metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7645 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The NFSv2/NFSv3 server in the nfsd subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.10.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a long RPC reply, related to net/sunrpc/svc.c, fs/nfsd/nfs3xdr.c, and fs/nfsd/nfsxdr.c. Tuomas Haanp채채 and Ari Kauppi discovered that the NFSv2 and NFSv3 server implementations in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain long RPC replies. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-lowlatency - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-79.100

linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-79.100

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-79.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1018.27').
